section.p: A supermarket chain wants to open a number of new branches for a maximum investment of 14 million dollar. The chain has 4 types of shops: A, B, C and D. In the following figure you can see the costs for setting up the four store types and the (expected) sales in the next financial year.

All new build branches can be ready for the next financial year. The possible locations are comparable in terms of population. The executive board wants the greatest possible sales of the new branches in the next financial year. How many branches of each type should be build to achieve this?.

ol.li: Build the model in Excel using the guidelines indicated in this textbook. You see an example in the following figure. Formulas need to be placed in the empty cells. Both decision variables have got a starting value of 2.
Enter the model in the Solver and then determine the optimal number of branches of each type and the expected total sales..

section.title: Answer

ol.li: Four decision variables: Number branches type A (= A), type B (= B), type C (= C) and type D (= D).
Objective function is the total sales (= S): S = 24*A + 20*B + 11*C + 5*D

Restrictions:
Maximum investment: 4*A + 3*B + 2*C + 1*D <= 14
Each number of branches is an integer: A = integer , B = integer , C = integer , D = integer
Each number of branches is a positive number: A >= 0 , B >= 0 , C >= 0 , D >= 0

section.p: Optimal number of branches type A = 0, type B = 4, type C = 1, type D = 0. The total sales is 91 million dollar.
